You should be aware that San Diego has a 12.5 percent hotel/resort tax that gets added to your bill. I didn't play golf this trip, but I will next time. I never saw a lot of players on the course. I believe it would be a great course to play because it looks like a top notch course and I doubt there would be much of a wait between holes. The fitness center was really nice with a lot of high end equipment. The pools and grounds are beautiful. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay at a 5 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at The Grand Del Mar”
Reviews.Author: Jackielynn1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our anniversary at The Grand Del Mar. It was absolutely amazing! Treatments at the spa followed by a relaxing afternoon and lunch at the pool was simply perfect. The pool attendents make sure your every want and need is attended to. The entire staff is wonderful and very welcoming. We've already booked our next visit for December to celebrate my birthday. I'm looking forward to making this our yearly getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Holy Wow, Batman - Service to the Max”
Reviews.Author: lookingforcool
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our wedding weekend in October 2009. When you're engaged/getting married/newlywed, you get kinda used to getting away with special requests on things and it's quite the treat. However - nobody treats you as well as the Grand Del Mar. The service on all levels [even/especially from those who didn't know about the wedding] was above and beyond anything I've experienced at any establishment. These people know how to treat their customers with respect and make them feel welcome. Beyond the service - EVERYTHING about this place is amazing. I could walk the labyrinthian halls for hours just staring at all the beautiful appointments on the ceilings, walls and floors. Gorgeous place. The food at the restaurants, even the little cafe, was astonishingly good. Beds are crazy comfortable. Views are stunning. The spa has two of the best masseuses we've ever met by far. Can't wait to go back to see Madeline. She is amazing. Short version? If you can afford to do so, stay at the Grand Del Mar. You will never be disappointed by this establishment or their amazing staff.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance at it's best”
Reviews.Author: lv4maui
Reviews.Content: We went for a quiet getaway and we're very impressed with this hotel. The rooms are spacious and elegant. The adult pool is luxurious with comfortable padded lounge chairs, underwater music, and frozen grapes. Sunscreen, magazines and cold water always available. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dkdjm
Reviews.Content: This was our 'home' during our visit to Comicon. The rooms we spacious and beautifully decorated. The bathroom was magnificent. As beautiful as the hotel is, the staff was so much more. They bend over backwards to accommodate any of needs while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great golf, great resort”
Reviews.Author: partrip1
Reviews.Content: If you desire a more detailed report, please go to www.partrip.com Briefly, the place is new, great food, great service. The golf is awesome and the scenery is great. The current rate of $395 a night is superb, really can't beat that. Place is not stuck up, very comfy feel, despite all the opulence.

Reviews.Title: “OFF THE CHARTS”
Reviews.Author: msw0961
Reviews.Content: Amazing.magnificent.unreal.Its really a great vacation. everyone from porters to pool staff to managment were great.8 diamond . .

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: hotnanny
Reviews.Content: Just got back from The Grand Del Mar, and can't wait to go back! It is truly the best hotel the Hubby and I have ever stayed at, including concierge level at The Venetian in Las Vegas. Our room was beautiful, the tub huge, fab mattress/linens, great service from the staff- and amazing grounds! We had a 3 night package deal, that included valet- and a $100 resort credit. I used it at the spectacular looking spa. I prefer the services at the Glen Ivy Day Spa, but the relaxation rooms are incredibly appointed. Our view was overlooking the croquet garden. High Tea was intimate in the Library, with great food/service. Loved the adult only pool/jacuzzi- complete with pool boys/girls. You will feel very pampered. :-) I do not hesitate to recommend this 5 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: DrSurf
Reviews.Content: It's nice on the exterior however it has very poor customer service, very expensive, and over-rated.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: pposte
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend for Opening Day at Del Mar. This place is so beautiful we almost passed up going to Opening Day just to enjoy the hotel more. The attention to detail is out of this world. From the customer service to the beautiful rooms, everything was fantastic. I have stayed in luxury hotels all over the world and this ranks as one of the best I have seen.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Jen G
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautifully furnished, comfortable and quiet. The family pool was wonderful with ample seating. Kids meals at the pool were only $6, however, most "adult" food was resort priced. We utilized the babysitting services and had a great (but quite pricey) dinner at Addisons. Overall, one of the nicest resorts we have visited and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “ruined our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Jaybee27
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to begin with this hotel, we ended up checking out two days earlier than we were due to. To start they put a holding charge of $6000 on our credit card for incidentals eh hello?? most hotels put $100 dollars max on. They never informed us they were doing this, which then ended up taking a whole 8 days to go back onto our credit card.. Next the hotel room was beyond tacky with all the faux gold fittings on everything and the real old fashioned curtains which wouldn't even block out the light properly, our view was of nothing practically. Hotel was full of screaming kids which totally put me off we were on our honeymoon obviously wanting to have some r&r, kids running up and down the corridors every morning waking us, screaming and running all over the restaurants. So off putting especially when you are paying like $495+ a night here. I rang the front desk to explain our concerns and express our unhappiness with all the noise from children etc, they were not one bit helpful or offering us alternative accommodation in the hotel, so i informed them we would be checking out two days earlier. On check out day the guy at the front desk was nothing but down right rude to us. I was just so disappointed this was part of our honeymoon and they'd taken the good out of it for us. I would not recommend this "over the top" hotel to anybody..

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a find”
Reviews.Author: luxtravelfamily
Reviews.Content: At first I was skeptical when we booked this for a 4 night stay with the family. How could a hotel that is not on the beach be a good place to stay? However we were all blown away by the plushness, value, size of rooms, quality of food (from all of the on property restaurants), and proximity to the beaches in Del Mar. The quality of materials used to build this hotel was impressive with no shortcuts found anywhere. I didn't play golf this time but the Fazio designed track is really impressive (the golf carts are even mini Bentley's!). A lot of times in high end resorts there is an attitude with the staff, however everyone here from the pool service, front desk, and valet where extremely nice, helpful and friendly. There is a beach shuttle available however we just drove everyday and they still provided us with ice and beach towels. Also have to mention that it was super quiet in our room so we had a good sleeping experience. Going back next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: VigilanteHospitality
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in a standard guest room, but, at any other hotel I've stayed in, this room would have been a suite. I usually stay at B & B's or smaller boutique hotels so this was quite a different experience, one I'm sorry I put off for so long. The hotel itself is so beautiful and the service was top notch. Our room was totally pristine and the staff was really knowledgeable and professional. I often feel when a staff is too professional, it can convey a certain iciness, however, at the The Grand Del Mar, it never felt this way. The views are gorgeous and they have the best pool I’ve ever been seen. There are so many amazing features and free amenities, like shoe shines and turndown service, it really is the lap of luxury. I usually don't spend that much on hotel rooms, but I felt it was worth every penny. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to splurge a little or, if this is the sort of place you are used to, I can't imagine you'd be disappointed. It was a really romantic getaway and I can’t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “This place truly exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: TeeLaw
Reviews.Content: My wife and two young children concluded our week long get away by spending 3 nights at the Grand Del Mar (after spending the first 3 nights at the Ritz Carlton - Laguna Niguel). I will not compare the two hotels as they both had things that made them unique and great properties. I must say; however, that my kids asked "Why didn't we come here in the first place." We were blown away by the service, architecture, resort amenities (the spa was awesome) and comfort of our Prada Suite which was so luxurious that we sort of felt guilty as it was a bit over the top but when you work hard, who is to say you should not enjoy the fruits of your success. My wife and I have been to some of the best resorts in the world, e.g., The Mandarin Oriental-NYC, Breakers-Palm Beach, Peninsula-Beverly Hills, Calistoga Ranch in Napa (oh and Ritz Laguna Niguel), to name a few. The Grand Del Mar was definitiely as good as, if not better all around than many of these other great luxury resorts. The kids explorer's club was the best kids program we have utilized and per our children, trumped that offered by the Ritz Kid's day camp. If you want to visit a place that will truly exceed your expectations reserve a Prada Suite at this fabulous resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a meeting”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedTravelers
Reviews.Content: This place deserves 5 stars. The grounds are absolutely pristine and the service is even better. The room, while a bit bigger than average for a resort, was quiet. The best part was the bathroom - it has to be 20 feet long, with two sinks, a tub, shower, closet, etc. In the room, as well as the grounds, every attention to detail was taken. The place is fairly new and not that crowded, so I hope that this quality keeps up. While this hotel is fairly close to the freeway it is not exactly in the middle of San Diego attractions. It is fine for a business meeting. Unless all you want to do is go to play golf and/or the spa and/or just hike it is fine, otherwise there is not much to attract you. While not as luxurious or the same level or service, La Costa (just up the road) would be a better choice for a getaway. The only complaint was that the food for such a first class place was barely above average. There was nothing special about it except for the orange juice, which was one of the best ever at any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “As Italy Should be”
Reviews.Author: SoCalSailors
Reviews.Content: Grand is an understatement for this resort. Everything about it is top notch. The staff has been very well trained from the first greeting to the last farewell, that is, if you ever leave. You won't want to. Food was excellent. The spa is fabulous. Rooms are lovely, large, comfortable. The golf course is a former public course but has been upgraded. It is overpriced for what it is, but is still a challenging course. We will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaThibaud
Reviews.Content: First rate in every respect. Service exceeds expectations. Compares favorably with high-end European Relais & Chateaux properties we've stayed in for taste and charm. Calm, quiet, exquisite attention to detail, including the lovely and unusual landscaping along the long walks that wrap around the resort. If you want the beach or nightlife, go elsewhere, and leave this place to us. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Plush new resort, amazing service overall”
Reviews.Author: cfhemail
Reviews.Content: My room was huge, had a large balcony overlooking the gorgeous lap pool and adult spa relaxation 'hot tub'. I didn't realize there was so much more to the resort until I took a walk around. There is a lot of detail work in the construction and decor - although some of it may be over the top, but overall beautiful hotel and setting. And though it's been open two years, it appears like it opened yesterday. High staff to guest ratio. Everyone polite, helpful (except for woman who assumed she could keep my change from coffee as her tip... would have given it anyway, but don't assume...) Beautiful lawns. Ideal for outdoor cocktails/dinner/weddings. Nearby La Jolla, but still a little drive to hot spots.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Does Not Come First”
Reviews.Author: COtraveler09
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively new "luxury" hotel and they have kinks to work out. The service was okay, but not at the level one should expect at this price hotel. The valet parkers did not come to greet us on arrival. They offered to provide directions on multiple occasions, but never were they able to actually provide them (had they not offered, I would not have noticed this). One day we were the first guest in the restaurant for breakfast (but well after it opened). One would think that this would allow us the opportunity for the nicest table. But no, the restaurant's chef had that one. Perhaps he was talking business with a potential client. I hope so, and that he got the deal, because he lost our future business. The drain in our bathtub was broken. We called and asked for it to be fixed. No one ever came to fix it. they did eventually come, the next day, after a second call. Not a big deal, except that our four-year old son could not take a bath. It should not have been broken in the first place (again, training staff to notice things like that would help - it was obviously broken). It shoudl not have taken two calls. Our stay was pleasant. I am sure a corporate event would be fine here. But note that it is the restaurant that has the high awards, not the hotel. I recommend staying somewhere else and dining here, if you want the food. I felt I had to post this review because the very few number of reviews puts this hotel far, far, far too high on the ratings list.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: kkmr1
Reviews.Content: We travel often, this time with our two teenage sons, and everyone had an outstanding experience. 5 nights went by far too quickly.. The staff, concierge group, restaurant management and golf pros were all top notch . The fire pits and fireplaces are an incredible after dinner retreat...

Reviews.Title: “Over The Top”
Reviews.Author: lovegoodhotels
Reviews.Content: I don't think that I've ever been to a hotel where I've thought, 'there isn't one thing wrong with this place'! From the time we drove up to the time we checked out, the service was impeccable. The common areas are majestic, with original artwork, chandeliers, marble columns and floors, mosaic tiles and interior period architecture. We had a King Fairway view room on the third (their highest) floor. The room is dreamy. Original art work hangs in the warm, lavishly decorated room, crown molding and stenciled designs are etched on the ceiling and lush linens, a soft bed and a gold renassaince framed Sony plasma t.v. are among the highlights. In the bathroom, the tub was extra deep and the shower larger than most hotels. The dual sink vanity had tons of counter space and lovely amenities, including a small plasma t.v. above the counter. The closet was quite large and the robes and slippers were plush. The food at this hotel excels at Addison, their five diamond, five star restaurant. The prices are appropriate and not excessive. The food is exquisite. The wine list was extensive. We had the prix fixe menu with wine pairings and it was probably the best dining experience we've ever had. I'll assure you, we are foodies and quite picky when it comes to restaurant food, so I don't make this recommendation lightly. The food at Amaya is good but not in league with Addison. In room dining was quick, delicious and always got our order right. Above all, remember that if a mistake is made with your order or with the service, let the manager know and he or she will be sure that you are happy or compensated for your trouble. They are not stingy here. This is true with all of their restaurants and their service in general. The spa was so relaxing and inviting. There are fresh fruits and nuts to munch on and all sorts of herbal teas as well. There are actual day beds to lay on before or after a treatment, as well as a whirlpool and sauna. The massage treatments as well were outstanding. The pools are all very nice with lovely cushioned lounges and heated even in late January. The grounds are green and lush. It is a short drive to the beach, if that is where you want to head. The concierge here is wonderful and will help you with anywhere you want to go. This hotel is not going to remain a best kept secret for long. It already attracts visitors from all over the world. It's quality and service are incomparable and the prices are such that almost anyone can afford a visit. We will be back, time and again.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless resort”
Reviews.Author: scooby19
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Del Mar over New Year's Eve week. This property is ideally located within a short distance from various points of interest. The resort is built near a reservation with beautiful hiking trails, an amazing golf course and lots of little hidden areas to kick back and relax. While the resort is large, the design makes every space seem intimate. Tea is served in a library lounge and has a lovely roaring fireplace. The spa is heavenly with a fantastic array of treatments. The fitness facilities are top notch and the service is absolutely flawless. We couldn't compliment the staff enough. This property features the only 5 diamond restaurant in San Diego - well deserved. The staff at the restaurant are enthusiastic and seem to really enjoy interacting with guests about the food and the wine. The food in the rest of the property is also excellent. If you are looking for a place to de-stress and unwind...look no further. We cannot wait to return to this lovely slice of heaven -- and with San Diego weather... anytime is the right time to visit this resort.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful & Grand Experience!”
Reviews.Author: leolady
Reviews.Content: The Grand del Mar is everything you could ask for in a 5-start resort! A large group of us stayed here for a job down in San Diego. The experience was fantastic for everyone as well as our clients. We couldn't have asked for more! The service was truly exceptional all around. They take good care of you and make you feel welcome. Staff is so friendly and very accommodating to your needs. The resort grounds are absolutely gorgeous!!! The rooms are quite spacious, comfortable and lovely. There is not one minus about this resort. It's really the perfect place to stay if you like luxury - for business or pleasure. I highly recommend it if you're traveling to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully refined hotle”
Reviews.Author: luxuriousliving
Reviews.Content: My partner and I checked in on Christmas Eve (with our two children) for 3 nights to celebrate Christmas in luxury. After reading all the other reviews, I can say that the hotel is exactly as descibed by everyone else. The approach to the hotel is a long driveway. From the minute you see the hotel, the luxuriousness of the property and location is apparent. We booked a standard double king guest room. After much consideration, we decided to share the room with our two boys (normally, we get them a separate room but given the "credit crunch", we thought that may be slightly extravagant this year). We had the cheapest view in the property of the gardens, but we were more than happy with our lovely view. Given the location, all views seem to be gorgeous and we were glad we didn't upgrade to a golf view. The rooms are spacious but the bathrooms were MASSIVE. One of the nicest bathrooms I have ever seen, due to the size and design. The outside swimming pools are gorgeous and we took advantage of the heated pools to get our daily swim in even on Christmas day. Most of the staff thought we were crazy but coming from London the weather was very mild! I had a pedicure in the spa and the service was great - a really good pedicure. Well worth the money. We ate in the Amaya restaurant on Christmas eve and the food was excellent. My partner said it was the most "melt in your mouth" beef he had ever been served in a restaurant. We had a lovely festive christmas brunch on christmas day. All the staff were fabulous and the food choice was perfect. The most noticeable part of the hotel are the great staff that the management employ. Every member of staff we met was genuinely helpful and interested in making sure you had a fabulous stay in the hotel. There was a great sense of pride and professionalism amongst the staff. I would most definitely recommend this as the hotel to stay in during a trip to San Diego. Is the hotel expensive - YES! But, it truly is a luxurious place to stay and in the end you get what you pay for. If i had to make any criticisms of the hotel, I would make two. 1) it seems ridiculous to charge a "valet" parking fee when the hotel is so spacious ( our rate had this included but i would be annoyed at having to pay a daily rate to park in the middle of the countryside) 2) we thought that a 22% service charge on the Christmas brunch was very steep, especially as it was a buffet!!!!!!!!!!! Our service charge for Christmas Day was $68 and the meal was only $40 per child and $80 per adult, with one bottle of wine on top. As Europeans, we thought this service charge was too high especially as we were getting up to get the food ourselves. I did leave this in my comments to the management. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone and would not even consider Coronado or downtown San Diego with sucha beautiful location on the doorstep. Try it - you will not be diappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl056
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Del Mar to celebrate my boyfriend's 40th birthday, added surprise he proposed to me on the night of his birthday! The hotel did not leave a detail uncovered for both great events. I was calling the hotel on one hand to set up plans for his 40th, meanwhile he was calling them to set up plans for our engagement. The conceirge staff were so helpful and friendly, (thanks Katie!), they made sure every detail of our stay was met. They sent champagne up to the room twice! The gave us an agenda when we first checked in, with our massage schedules, dinner, breakfast the next morning. I did the massage package, which included 2 60 min massages, parking, breakfast for 2 and a fairway view room. The rooms are absolutely amazing. First class in every way, very big, great marble bathroom, comfortable bed, flat screen TV, Ipod player. The grounds are impeccable, great pool, we had lunch at the pool bar, food was really good. Addison's (their restaurant) was amazing. They take you over there (its just down the way) in an S class Mercedes (very nice touch!). The food was very good, very expensive (we paid $400+ for dinner for 2). I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who really wants to be pampered and catered to, its a fabulous experience!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Ognianka
Reviews.Content: I cannot find one bad thing to say about this property--by far, this is the most beautiful, luxurious, ourstanding hotel I have ever stayed at. It beats the St. Regis or the Waldorf Astoria any day. Every little detail was well thought of, the furnishings are absolutely beautiful, the rooms are HUGE by any standards. The service is absolutely outstanding. When we arrived, I had a bad cold, and was sniffly and coughing during checkin. After we went to the room, in about 15 min houskeeping came to the room with soup, compliments of front desk wishing me to get well soon!!! The concierge arranged for baby sitting services and even though I kept changing the date and time I need them, they never complained and always had a smile on their face. we LOVED the hotel and will return as soon as we can!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon Resort”
Reviews.Author: Alison1975
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for a better place to celebrate our honeymoon. The room was amazing. The staff was very helpful without being pushy. The restaurant was great. The views were beautiful. We decided to split our trip and stay downtown at the US Grant and then head out to the Grand Del Mar for the final two nights of our honeymoon. We would have stayed all four nights except that the Grand is very expensive. We did the Breakfast package for 410 a night and it was worth it. We got a $65 credit per day for breakfast. We ate like royalty on that 65 dollars each day. Our last night the hotel delivered all the fixings for S'mores down to the firepit for us to share together. When we returned to the room they had sent a plate of chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of champagne to the room.

Reviews.Title: “lovely location, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: MonicaW_8
Reviews.Content: Had a warm welcome, lovely professional staff, porters and waiters are very friendly when coming to the rooms, nice and chatty. Staff seem to enjoy being there and getting along with guests. Rooms are excellent, great views, spacious, beds fantastic and bathrooms of excellent standards, huge bathtubs.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice time at a corporate event at The Grand”
Reviews.Author: JFulton
Reviews.Content: Setting: Beautiful, but note that this is not in Del Mar (or even that close). Located on the Penasquitos Canyon Preserve, this is five miles inland. For those familiar with Aviara and La Costa, this is a little more rustic as there is much less development surrounding The Grand Hotel: Very modern, but the other reviewers are correct - the decor is way over the top. Its supposed to be "moorish" but it feel boorish. Almost like someone had a great idea but got carried away. Facilities: Did not play golf, but the course looks awesome. Pools are very nice and perfectly heated - not too hot, not too cold. Spa is first rate. Food: Ate lunch by the pool and the food was actually lower priced than I expected for this type of resort. Beer for $6 - I can handle that. Heck, I pay that on an airplane. Did not try the restaurants, but had a drink in each of the bars (lobby and Amaya). Both were above average for a hotel bar. Service: Overall very good. Housekeeping for us was particularly strong. Had turndown both nights and the second night someone actually folded clothes we had lying around!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the visit!”
Reviews.Author: tvlingjr
Reviews.Content: Just last week when a couple of business travelers from the Northwest walked through the doors of The Grand Del Mar. Little did they know, they soon would become famous for having a terrible hotel experience, and creating one of the most entertaining Power point decks ever made to share with all our clients. This classic Power point deck will take you through the duos late night discovery that guest just don't matter. From there these two detail what exactly a reservation agent "described" is (maybe not as rock solid as we all think), night clerk Mike's career path, and their forced to accept par service. The hotel appears to have lost all of what was the good staff. No one knew what was going on and things were a disaster. We arrived late and with very few bags. The pushy doorman insisted on taking our small bag to the room. ( We let him because we understand that everyone could use a buck today) All was good but it was late and after two phone calls to the desk and 40 minutes later the little bag arrived. When we asked what appeared to be a housekeeper bringing it up, we were told that the bellman had gone home for the night. The next day we just wanted to share the story with the manager and were told he would contact us shortly. “Surprise” we never heard from him. We had our meeting and it was fine. They had problems with the AC but often in monster hotels this can happen. When we went to check out they said that they could not find our car keys, after about 30 minutes they found that they had been tossed to the bottom of their storage area. So the rule is don’t bother with this one. It is very grand in structure but poor in service.

Reviews.Title: “Lap of Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: This resort was way up there in luxury and service - the second best we've ever stayed at - very opulent. In the words of the in-room guest book: "...inspired by the rich, decorative arts of Spain, Portugal, Italy and Morroco"; "colorful palette, graceful arched doorways, rotundas, vibrant tile, wood-beamed ceilings, ornate stone and wrought-iron accents, decorative columns, parquet flooring and gracious verandas.". More simply put, you walk in and say "Wow!" - several times. First impressions were exceptional, from the eucalyptus-scented hand towels presented at the front desk during check-in, to the fresh lemonade, iced tea, and cookies and huge, aromatic, floral arrangement in the lobby. The concierge desk was very nice and helpful, especially Gabrielle and Lynette. We asked their advice every day. We requested and got a room with a fairway (golf course) view - the one downside is there's only a standing balcony, with insufficient room for chairs to sit and enjoy the view. We found the room to be very luxurious - all the amenities you could possibly want and more. The room (389) had a great layout, including a bathroom with a huge tub, two sinks, separate shower and toilet, and a folding window above the tub that opens into the main bedroom. There are lots of subtle, sometimes hidden extras, like a vanity with a top that opens up to reveal a large mirror and provide a compartment for your wife's things. The bedroom offered plenty of drawer space, slide-out table tops, a beautiful corner couch, cushions, and ottoman for relaxing, and a large flat screen TV on the wall. Two newspapers were delivered to the room each day, and we were asked if we wanted any others. Valet parking is the only available option, and they charge quite a bit for it ($30 plus tips). I complained because I didn't see this spelled out up front until my reservation was confirmed - the resort very kindly said they would waive the fee. Each time you leave the premises, the valet offers bottles of cold water for the road. Nice. A plus for us was that we rarely heard or saw any other people in the adjacent rooms - either the walls are nice and thick or no one was in them. A couple of relatively minor downsides: We only got turndown service on the first night of our four night stay. Not sure why. We loved it when we got it. We were offered and accepted an in-room coffee maker, but housekeeping just didn't seem to know how to handle this extra. They consistently failed to clean and provision it, even bringing coffee bags without filters on the last day. On a similar note, we requested extra towels (to their credit, the hotel asks before you arrive), but housekeeping had to be reminded to keep replacing them. We used in-room dining several times, but got tired of it. Would have liked some simpler, less "frou frou" options to choose from. We switched to muffins from the coffee shop (Cent'Anni) for the last couple of mornings. Speaking of dining, we opted not to eat at their highly touted restaurant, Addison - settling instead for "second best", Amaya. It was fine - great decor, nice waiters, good food, very classy - frankly it was hard for us to believe Amaya wasn't the best! I can't emphasize enough how pleasant and accommodating the staff was. We had the feeling they would do anything within their power to make our stay a nice one (and they succeeded). Also, the resort is absolutely beautiful. Be forewarned, though - it's about a half hour drive north of San Diego just off I-5, so it's not right in the heart of the city if that's what you're looking for. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price you pay!”
Reviews.Author: mikemyers999
Reviews.Content: Earleir this month my wife and I arrived at the hotel for what was to be a romantic getaway, it turned out to be less romance, and more of a disappointment. We arrived at the hotel at about 2pm, found it desolated; no concierge and only one person behind the desk who appeared to be overworked and having a horrible day, made us feel like an imposition, yet another person tasking her patience. We were understanding since we could see how understaffed and overworked she was however, arriving in our room to find that both trash bins; bedroom and bathroom had not been emptied, we wondered if the rest of the room was clean. It did not instill the confidence we expected for the price we paid. Later that evening while at dinner, we chatted with another couple with a similar experience, which confirmed our fears. Our “dining experience” as they described it was less than impressive and average at best. You are better served by traveling far, far, away to La Jolla where a lovely diner is easier to find at a more reasonable price with better service. We left the next morning and stayed in La Jolla, that made our trip to San Diego worth wile. If you are looking for overpriced service with little to show for it, you will love The Grand Del Mar.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!! Perfect in everyway!”
Reviews.Author: melfreeman08
Reviews.Content: This resort is amazing. We stayed there for two nights in a beautiful room that overlooked one of the pools. The staff was amazing and exceeded my expectations. The rooms are gorgeous and the bathtub is gigantic, perfect for bubble baths. The food was excellent. We dined at the restaurants and we also ordered room service a couple of times. The spa was equally great with a beautiful lounge area. The only downside was that the golf course had recently been worked on, and my husband said that the grass was difficult to play on becayse of this. Overall, I highly recommend this resort to people who are looking for a great relaxing vacation. I would also pick this hotel over the Four Seasons in Carlsbad, which says a lot!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service, Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gemes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Del Mar over Labor Day weekend. We were extremely impressed with the quality of service, even during what was presumably one of the busiest weekends of the year. We stayed at the hotel with our 5 month old baby. We requested a crib for the room when we made our reservations. The hotel contacted us before our stay and asked us the name of our baby. When we arrived in our room, the hotel had spelled out our baby's name in colorful sponges around the bathtub. The hotel also gave us a gift for the baby upon our arrival. We were blown away by the attention to detail. The food at the resort is better than most other hotel food, and there are plenty of options. We also thought the food was reasonably priced, especially compared to other hotels of this class. The pool area was very crowded, but the staff still managed to help us quickly. The hotel is a little isolated, so a car is a necessity. But, the isolation also makes for scenic views of the golf course and the mountains. The hotel is in a beautiful setting -- much nicer than the Four Seasons. The staff consistently impressed us. Everyone seemed genuinely happy to help us. The concierge and bell man remembered our name after our first meeting. We are usually very picky travelers, but the Grand Del Mar exceeded our expectations in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in Del Mar”
Reviews.Author: CACouple111
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I recently had the pleasure of staying at The Grand Del Mar in August (I was invited to stay at the resorts for two comped nights through a work contact). This place is absolutely amazing! We had a 1-bedroom Palazzo Suite that was extremely luxurious. The decor was perfectly done and the bathrooms were palatial. There wasn't a detail missing: ipod sound-dock and Bose speakers? Check. Champagne flutes and highball glasses? Check. Books in case you forgot reading material? Check. DVD's? Check. We are quite familiar with Del Mar, and yet didn't feel the need to leave the resort ONCE during our stay! We made great use of the pools (there are several), we had an amazing spa day (see my review of their spa), we enjoyed brunch at Amaya and had an 8-course tasting dinner at Addison. The staff could not have been more polite or eager to help! I highly recommend this resort to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Utter Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Civillit1
Reviews.Content: I was confused. I looked at the initial reviews and saw sixteen 5's and four less than 5's and had to wonder why? How do 80% of people adore a place without fail and 10% say is is a bad Motel 6 (two 2's). I now see. People who find this property sub-standard in any way complained of their experience from a lunch stay here. And their complaints rate just as valid as all of us who have had the pleasure to truly experience a first class hotel. At least lie and say you have more experience with one of the top hotels in the country before you trash it publicly. Put your name and face up to be scrutinized and laughed at for daring to spend more time writing a review than you spent in the hotel. The hotel is superb. First lass in all respects.. From the front desk clerk escorting you to a room to the concierge calling the Manager of Addison (a top flight restaurant within the hotel) to squeeze a party of 7 in for dinner same day when we had been turned away four times. The grounds are immaculate, the staff professional and friendly. Amaya, their casual dining location is superb. Don't miss the fig, gorgonzola and Balsamic flat bread or the lobster bisque. I have stayed worldwide and in some of the top rated hotels in the world. This deserves to be counted among them.

HotelInfo.Name: The Grand Del Mar
HotelInfo.Address: 5300 Grand Del Mar Court, San Diego, CA 92130
